content.raw:
If the goal is to remove all the provideFeedback support,

* Should we remove the SDF <provide_feedback> elements?
* There is also a test in test/sdf_deprecated/pr2_test.world with <provideFeedback> old tags. Should we removed the tags (or the whole test)?
* Should we remove the reading of the <provide_feedback> tag in [gazebo/physics/Joint.cc:109](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1ab8eb1630d4392bc77e7e6ea800be5994cee38d/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc#cl-109)?
* Should we remove the SetProvideFeedback() overloaded method in [gazebo/physics/ode/ODEJoint.cc:1227](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1ab8eb1630d4392bc77e7e6ea800be5994cee38d/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEJoint.cc#cl-1227)?
* Should we remove the SetProvideFeedback() call in [gazebo/physics/BulletJoint.cc:351](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1ab8eb1630d4392bc77e7e6ea800be5994cee38d/gazebo/physics/bullet/BulletJoint.cc#cl-351)?
* Should we remove the SetProvideFeedback() method in [gazebo/physics/Joint.cc:629](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1ab8eb1630d4392bc77e7e6ea800be5994cee38d/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc#cl-629)?

Probably, none of this makes any sense, but just in case.

  • Should we remove the SetProvideFeedback() method in gazebo/physics/Joint.cc:629?

Probably, none of this makes any sense, but just in case.

content.raw:
* There is no `SetProvideFeedback` in BulletJoint.cc

* `SetProvideFeedback` is required in Joint.cc because it's needed of `ODEJoint.cc`

* `SetProvideFeedback` is required in ODEJoint.cc

* The `<provide_feedback>` is in SDFormat and should be read in Joint.cc
content.html:
• There is no SetProvideFeedback in BulletJoint.cc

  • SetProvideFeedback is required in Joint.cc because it's needed of ODEJoint.cc

  • SetProvideFeedback is required in ODEJoint.cc

  • The <provide_feedback> is in SDFormat and should be read in Joint.cc

content.raw: I see, I thought we wanted to get rid of ProvideFeedback everywhere. Sorry for the noise.
content.html: I see, I thought we wanted to get rid of ProvideFeedback everywhere. Sorry for the noise.

content.raw: We should check with @hsu because I didn't know that we had intended to remove this. In [sdformat pull request 38](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/38/add-provide_feedback-for-bullet-joint/diff), we moved the `<provide_feedback>` tag, but I wasn't aware that it would be removed.
content.html: We should check with @hsu because I didn't know that we had intended to remove this. In sdformat pull request 38, we moved the <provide_feedback> tag, but I wasn't aware that it would be removed.

content.raw: it looks like we moved sdf definition of `<provide_feedback>` up one level from within `<joint><ode><provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback></ode></joint>` to `<joint><provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback></joint>` but we did not update `parser_urdf.cc` to translate urdf to sdf correspondingly.  While it worked when `ODEJoint` still parsed `<provide_feedback>`, but since that deprecated parsing code was removed from `ODEJoint` the feedback data never gets filled.  Removing this mechanism altogether will fix the error messages, but I think this approach might have significant impact on performance.  On another note, Simbody could also use this flag to improve performance when joint force torque is not needed.
content.html: it looks like we moved sdf definition of <provide_feedback> up one level from within <joint><ode><provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback></ode></joint> to <joint><provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback></joint> but we did not update parser_urdf.cc to translate urdf to sdf correspondingly. While it worked when ODEJoint still parsed <provide_feedback>, but since that deprecated parsing code was removed from ODEJoint the feedback data never gets filled. Removing this mechanism altogether will fix the error messages, but I think this approach might have significant impact on performance. On another note, Simbody could also use this flag to improve performance when joint force torque is not needed.

content.raw:
The <provide_feedback> tag is in sdf. If set, it triggers ODEJoint/BulletJoint to setup joint feedback. I'm not sure that Joint::provideFeedback is needed as a flag.

As John mentioned, I think we only need to update `parser_urdf`.
content.html:
The <provide_feedback> tag is in sdf. If set, it triggers ODEJoint/BulletJoint to setup joint feedback. I'm not sure that Joint::provideFeedback is needed as a flag.

As John mentioned, I think we only need to update parser_urdf.
